Vulnerabilities: Insecure use of scoped style attribute

Steps.Description: The attacker logs into the website with the provided credentials.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to gain access to the website and gather information about its behavior.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses the provided credentials to log in.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully gains access to the website.

Steps.Description: The attacker uses Burp Suite to intercept and analyze the requests made by the website.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects that the website might reveal sensitive information or vulnerabilities through its intermediate requests.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker configures Burp Suite to intercept the website's requests and inspects them.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker identifies a 302 found page with HTML and JavaScript content.

Steps.Description: The attacker analyzes the HTML and JavaScript content of the intercepted response.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that there might be vulnerabilities or clues within the HTML and JavaScript code.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker examines the scoped style attribute and the navigator.battery.charging call in the JavaScript code.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers that the scoped style attribute is only supported in Firefox 21-54 and the navigator.battery.charging call may be vulnerable.

Steps.Description: The attacker performs browser fingerprinting to determine the version of Firefox being used.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker needs to know the version of Firefox in order to exploit the scoped style attribute vulnerability.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses Burp Suite to modify the User-Agent header and tries different Firefox versions until finding one that matches the vulnerability.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers that Firefox version 43.0 is vulnerable to the scoped style attribute exploitation.

Steps.Description: The attacker exploits the scoped style attribute vulnerability using the discovered Firefox version.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker expects that by exploiting the scoped style attribute vulnerability, they can bypass some security measures or gain unauthorized access.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker modifies the User-Agent header in Burp Suite to use Firefox version 43.0 and sends the request.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully bypasses the unsupported browser detection and gains access to the flag.
